intro: Adina griffithii, commonly known as the Indian rosewood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark, aromatic wood and glossy, elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, red berries. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and wood quality, it is cultivated in gardens and used in traditional crafts.
